reasoning: I selected five categories that highlight nuanced policy differences among the candidates. These categories focus on specific municipal policies and societal issues that have clear distinctions in candidate responses, such as the approach to youth engagement, taxation, forest conservation, services in English, and housing affordability. The alternatives for each category were derived from patterns in the candidates' responses to related questions. Excerpts were chosen to directly support the assigned positions, reflecting the candidates' comments and formal responses. The confidence scores indicate how strongly the excerpts align with the assigned positions.

categories.label: Youth Engagement in Decision-Making
categories.description: Candidates' support for youth councils having the right to speak and be present in municipal decision-making processes.

categories.label: Balancing Municipal Finances
categories.description: Preference for methods to balance municipal budgets, focusing on tax increases versus budget cuts.

categories.label: Forest Conservation Investment
categories.description: Support for increasing municipal investment in forest conservation.

categories.label: Municipal Services Offered in English
categories.description: Support for offering municipal services in English in addition to the official languages.

categories.label: Affordable Housing Access
categories.description: Support for guaranteeing access to affordable housing for low-income individuals, such as students.
